When a great gladiator or wrestler meets their demise, their soul can sometimes linger out of a love for combat and sport. Every grappling spirit manifests a mask that represents the legacy of the warrior they were during their life. **[Recall Knowledge - Spirit](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11)): DC 28 **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 28 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23 [Grappling Spirit](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1868) **Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 107 **Perception** +17; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +19, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +21, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +18, [Gladiatorial Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +15, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +20, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) +20 **Str** -5 **Dex** +6 **Con** +4 **Int** +0 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +5 --- **AC** 27 **Fort** +19 **Ref** +19 **Will** +15 **HP** 125 ([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), precision, [_sleep_](/Spells.aspx?ID=288) **Resistances** all damage 10 (except [force](/Traits.aspx?ID=75), [_ghost touch_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=297), or [positive](/Traits.aspx?ID=128); double resistance vs. non-[magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)) **Warrior's Mask** A grappling spirit wears a mask that allows them to abandon their original form and become a warrior focused solely on combat. This mask is quasi-corporeal, allowing it to be manipulated by both corporeal and incorporeal creatures. A creature who has the grappling spirit [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) or [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33) can remove the mask as an Interact action by succeeding at an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check against the grappling spirit's Fortitude DC. Removing a grappling spirit's mask causes the spirit to fly into a frenzy. The grappling spirit becomes [quickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=32) and can use their extra action to [Fly](/Actions.aspx?ID=94), [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=35), or Strike. They also gain a +4 status bonus to damage rolls, and they take a –4 status penalty to AC and Reflex saving throws. If the mask is put back on, the grappling spirit ends their frenzy. --- **Speed** fly 60 feet **Melee** ghostly hand +21 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188)), **Damage** 2d10+12 negative plus [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27) **Ghostly Grasp** A grappling spirit can [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=35) corporeal creatures despite being incorporeal. The grappling spirit uses their [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check to Grapple as normal but can't use Athletics for other actions that require corporeal contact, like [Force Open](/Actions.aspx?ID=34) or [Trip](/Actions.aspx?ID=40). **Submission Lock** ([Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188)) **Requirements** The grappling spirit has a creature [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) or [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33); **Effect** The spirit saps their opponent's strength with a supernatural grip. The grappling spirit attempts an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check to [Grapple](/Actions.aspx?ID=35) a creature they have grabbed or restrained, also adding 4d10+12 negative damage, depending on the result.
**Critical Success** The creature takes double damage. If it's already [enfeebled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13), it falls [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38). If not, it is enfeebled 2 until the end of its next turn and enfeebled 1 for 1 minute.
**Success** The creature takes full damage and is enfeebled 1 until the end of its next turn. **Teleporting Clothesline** ([Conjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=33), [Occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120), [Teleportation](/Traits.aspx?ID=156)) **Requirements** The grappling spirit has a creature [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) or [restrained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33); Effect The grappling spirit [pushes](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) the creature 15 feet in a straight line. The spirit immediately teleports 20 feet to intercept. They make a ghostly hand Strike against the creature. On a hit, the creature is knocked [prone](/Conditions.aspx?ID=31), and on a critical hit, it also takes an additional 2d6 bludgeoning damage as it's driven to the ground. **Victory Celebration** If a spirit knocks a creature [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38), each creature within 60 feet that witnesses the victory is targeted with a DC 26 [_roaring applause_](/Spells.aspx?ID=987) spell. The spirit must spend all their actions until the end of the turn celebrating, and a new medal or belt appears on the spirit.
Lands of Champions While a grappling spirit can be found almost anywhere notable combats are held, a few regions on Golarion are known for their prominence. The Hold of Belkzen is home to orc grapplers who become grappling spirits, while the wrestlers of Arcadia and Iblydos tend to return for one last glorious match. Grappling spirits are particularly common in the Lands of Second Souls in southern Arcadia.
Retiring a Grappling Spirit The means of appeasing each grappling spirit, allowing it to pass on, vary. Some seek one last match worthy of their skill, while others wish to win a major bout in front of an adoring crowd or even suffer an epic defeat at the hands of a worthy successor. They tend not to be malicious, just entirely dedicated to competition.
